action_plan.estimated_scope: Regenerate all 33 examples using ggen itself (dogfooding). Estimated 80-120 hours total; 2.8-4.4x speedup with EPIC 9 orchestration. Single-pass construction enabled by specification closure for each example.
critical_path: RW-001: Set up example regeneration framework (ggen commands, templates)
RW-002 through RW-010: Foundational examples (template, CLI, basic generation)
RW-011 through RW-020: Intermediate examples (APIs, schemas, configs)
RW-021 through RW-033: Advanced examples (services, architectures, deployments)
Validation checkpoint: All examples compile and pass tests
Publication: Publish 33 example templates to marketplace

task_list.description: Set up ggen command templates and scripts for batch regeneration. Create framework for running ggen ai project and ggen ai generate across all examples.
Regenerate basic-template-generation using ggen ai template command. Demonstrates fundamental template creation and Tera syntax.
Regenerate ai-template-creation using ggen ai generate with mock mode. Demonstrates AI-powered template creation.
Regenerate simple-project as the simplest complete ggen project. Single ggen.toml, minimal ontology, basic templates.
Regenerate complete-project-generation. Full REST API with 6 endpoints, integration tests, deployment scripts.
Regenerate cli-noun-verb example. Demonstrates clap-noun-verb paradigm with OpenAPI generation.
Regenerate rust-structs example. RDF ontology → Rust struct definitions.
Regenerate ai-code-generation example. Uses ggen ai generate for Rust service templates.
Regenerate config-generator. Demonstrates YAML/TOML config generation from ontology.
Regenerate validation-schemas. JSON Schema, Zod, and async-validator from RDF.
Regenerate database-schema. SQL DDL, Rust models, migrations from RDF ontology.
Regenerate openapi example. Full OpenAPI 3.0 spec generation from RDF.
Regenerate openapi-variants. Multiple OpenAPI templates for different frameworks.
Regenerate rest-api-advanced. Advanced REST API with authentication, CORS, error handling.
Regenerate graphql-schema. GraphQL schema and resolver generation from RDF.
Regenerate grpc-service. gRPC proto file and Rust service generation.
Regenerate middleware-stack. HTTP middleware generation for Axum/Actix.
Regenerate comprehensive-rust-showcase. Full-featured example with 6+ templates, database, deployment.
Regenerate microservices-architecture. Multi-service architecture with shared templates.
Regenerate thesis-gen. Academic paper and thesis generation from RDF ontology.
Regenerate cli-subcommand. Simple CLI with subcommand structure generation.
Regenerate api-endpoint. Single endpoint generation template.
Regenerate ai-templates. AI-generated template collection.
Regenerate advanced-lifecycle-demo. Workspace member demonstrating lifecycle system.
Regenerate advanced-sparql-graph. Workspace member with SPARQL demonstrations.
Regenerate ggen-usage-wrapping. Workspace member wrapping ggen in custom workflows.
Regenerate cli-workspace-example. Complete workspace with multiple crates.
Regenerate workspace-project. Orchestrator for all other examples.
Regenerate electric-schema. ElectricSQL schema generation from RDF.
Regenerate fastapi-from-rdf. Python FastAPI generation from RDF ontology.
Regenerate full-stack-app. Rust backend + frontend template generation.
Regenerate maturity-matrix-showcase. Demonstrates project maturity levels and progression.
Regenerate telemetry-demo. OpenTelemetry instrumentation code generation.
Validation checkpoint: All batch 1 examples (RW-001 through RW-005) compile and pass tests.
Validation checkpoint: All batch 2 examples (RW-006 through RW-010) compile and pass tests.
Validation checkpoint: All batch 3 examples (RW-011 through RW-017) compile and pass tests.
Validation checkpoint: All batch 4 examples (RW-018 through RW-023) compile and pass tests.
Validation checkpoint: All batch 5 examples (RW-024 through RW-033) compile and pass tests.
Generate comprehensive documentation for all 33 examples. Update README.md with regeneration sources.
Publish all 33 regenerated examples to marketplace as reusable templates.
Comprehensive integration tests: Verify all examples can be consumed from marketplace and regenerated.

batch_1.name: Framework & Foundation
batch_1.description: Set up regeneration framework and create 4 foundational examples
batch_1.reasoning: RW-001 must complete first, then RW-002-005 can run in parallel (no cross-dependencies)

batch_2.name: Low-Complexity Examples
batch_2.description: 5 intermediate examples with clear patterns and templates
batch_2.reasoning: All depend only on RW-001; no cross-dependencies; can parallelize fully

batch_3.name: API & Schema Examples
batch_3.reasoning: Most depend only on RW-001 or RW-012; limited cross-dependencies; can parallelize

batch_4.name: Advanced Examples
batch_4.reasoning: Depend on batch 2 or 3 examples; can parallelize once dependencies ready

batch_5.name: Workspace & Validation
batch_5.reasoning: Depend on batch 1-4; can all parallelize once prerequisites done

criteria: All batch 1 examples regenerated with ggen commands
Each has .ggen/generation.log showing regeneration source
All compile: cargo build --all-examples
All pass unit tests: cargo test --examples
Framework documented with usage instructions
All batch 2 examples follow regeneration pattern
Templates are DRY and reusable
All compile and pass tests
README.md files show ggen command used
No manual code in generated examples
OpenAPI, gRPC, GraphQL examples conform to standards
All generated schemas valid (openapi-spec-validator, protoc, graphql-core)
Integration tests pass for all examples
No hardcoded paths or environment-specific config
validation_checkpoints.success_criteria: Schema validation passes; integration tests 100% pass

criteria: All advanced examples demonstrate ggen dogfooding
Comprehensive-rust-showcase builds and runs successfully
Microservices and lifecycle examples work end-to-end
All dependency specifications satisfied
validation_checkpoints.success_criteria: Complex examples execute successfully; no unmet dependencies

criteria: All 33 examples regenerated and validated
Marketplace publication metadata complete for each example
README.md documents full regeneration and consumption flow
All SLOs met: generation <5s per example, validation <30s batch
validation_checkpoints.success_criteria: All 33 examples ready for publication; documentation complete

criteria: Consume 5+ examples from marketplace successfully
Regenerate consumed examples using ggen commands
Output matches original examples
Full CI/CD pipeline passes: check + lint + test + docs
Zero unfixed Andon signals (RED: errors, YELLOW: warnings)
validation_checkpoints.success_criteria: Full round-trip success; examples proven reproducible from marketplace

critical_risks.mitigation: Store ggen commands in .ggen/generation.log; include reproduction scripts; add CI job to regenerate monthly
Audit dependency graph before starting; ensure framework (RW-001) is dependency-free; use DAG validation

critical_risks.risk: Some examples require features not yet in ggen
critical_risks.mitigation: Flag unimplemented features early; prioritize feature implementation; create fallback manual examples

critical_risks.risk: Examples break due to template syntax changes
critical_risks.mitigation: Version templates; pin ggen version per example; maintain backward compatibility layer

execution_risks.mitigation: Use task queue (Slack integration); hourly sync; red-flag unblocked dependencies
Run small sample validation early (RW-002, RW-007); fail fast; iterate framework before full scale
Track actual hours per example; adjust batch sizes dynamically; re-baseline estimates after batch 2

quality_risks.risk: Generated examples don't demonstrate ggen capabilities well
quality_risks.mitigation: Peer review regenerated examples; test with new users; iterate templates based on feedback
Run benchmarks on key examples; compare before/after; profile if regressions detected

andon_signals.trigger: Example fails to compile or cargo test fails
andon_signals.action: STOP batch; fix immediately; revert if needed; document root cause
Add to backlog; fix before checkpoint; don't block batch progression

andon_signals.trigger: All tests pass + no clippy warnings + documentation complete
andon_signals.action: Proceed to next batch; update progress tracker

risk_mitigation.mitigation_summary: Adopt small-batch waterfall with continuous validation. RUN-TIME SAFEGUARD: If any batch fails validation, pause parallelization and revert to sequential mode for that batch. Feature gaps trigger immediate implementation, not workarounds. Maintain ggen command reproducibility at all costs—examples are the proof ggen works.

phase_1_preparation.deliverable: RW-001 complete; ready to start batch 1

tasks: Regenerate RW-006 through RW-010 in parallel
Regenerate API/schema examples RW-011 through RW-017
Regenerate advanced examples RW-018 through RW-023
Regenerate workspace examples RW-024 through RW-033
phase_6_finalization.deliverable: All 33 examples complete; documentation + marketplace ready

execution_strategy.total_estimated_time: 52-65 hours (sequential baseline); 18-28 hours (with EPIC 9 parallelization = 2.8-3.6x speedup)

completion: All 33 examples regenerated using ggen commands (not manual)
Each example has .ggen/generation.log documenting regeneration source
All examples pass tests: cargo test --examples
All validation checkpoints pass (VAL-001 through VAL-FINAL)
quality: Zero Andon RED signals (compilation errors, test failures)
Zero clippy warnings in generated code
Documentation complete and accurate for all examples
Schema validation passes for all API/schema examples
deployment: Round-trip test: consume → regenerate → verify successful
CI/CD pipeline: all checks + lints + tests pass
proof_of_dogfooding: Examples demonstrate ggen's full capability range
New users can follow examples to learn ggen
Examples serve as living documentation of ggen features
Examples are reproducible and maintainable long-term
